messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Unschoolinging college
messages.msgSnippet: unschoolingbasicsThey are available for free in FL through flvs.net. And I know they are available in other states through flvs too but I don t know how that
messages.messageBody:
unschoolingbasicsThey are available for free in FL through flvs.net. And I know they are available in other states through flvs too but I don't know how that works. They are very helpful though if you email or call.

Nance

Re: Unschoolers colleging
Posted by: "shari bergquist" shari.bergquist@... stampymom
Sun Dec 9, 2007 8:05 pm (PST)
where did she find these online middle school classes? Shari

On Dec 8, 2007 8:22 AM, Nance Confer <marbleface@...> wrote:

> unschoolingbasicsAnd, in my DD's case, are thrilled to have her as a
> student. She takes initiative, pays attention to the schedule, checks in
> with the teacher when she needs something, proceeds on her own when she
> doesn't. I get many compliments (nice for the Mom :) ) and I get to explain
> to the teachers that it's really not so much me as years of her learning to
> be in charge of her own learning and time that result in a person who can do
> these things.
>
> These are online middle school-level classes she is taking, not college.
> But I think she'll be fine if she decides to go to college.



[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
